page.title: 11MY GRANDAD AND GRANDMA
page.content: My Grandad was born in{Poland.}He grew up to be in the army. It was the time that{Germany}was fighting Poland. He met my Grandma in a{concentration {camp.}The{Polish}uniform was a{German uniform with a white and red armband. (Thats the colour of the Polish flag.) A line of men, women and even children stood outside the concentration camp {waiting}to be{killed.}My Grandad and Grandma were lucky because a man next to my Grandad got killed. On that night my Grandad and Grandma escaped. They went past an{electric fence}and the Germans nearly found them. They escaped to{Italy}and got married. Their first son died. And they moved to Wales, and had my mum. They moved again, had my Auntie Krysia and so on. Then they came to England, lived in a house in Denison Road. { Maria Malinowska
